itemDescription: Oldest living recipient of the George Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Bertram Stuart Trevelyan Archer,  (3 February 1915 – 2 May 2015), known as Stuart Archer, was a recipient of the George Cross, the highest British and Commonwealth award for gallantry not in the face of the enemy. On 3 February 2015 Archer became the first recipient of the Victoria Cross or the George Cross to reach 100 years of age.
